subject: Languages
title: French Becomes the Language of Diplomacy
description: A micro-lesson that makes French Becomes the Language of Diplomacy usable.

hook.text: For three centuries, every European treaty was written in French. It was the language of power.

buildup.text: After Louis XIV made France Europe's cultural center, French became the elite lingua franca.

discovery.text: Diplomats from Russia to Turkey conducted negotiations in French, not their native tongues.

twist.text: The Treaty of Versailles in 1919 was the first major treaty also written in English.

climax.text: French remains an official language of the UN, the EU, NATO, and the Olympic Games.

punchline.text: French was the world's language of power before English took its seat.

quiz.question: Which treaty was the first major one also written in English?
